results.definition: the speech act of continuing a conversational exchange
a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some antecedent stimulus or agent
examples: his responses have slowed with age

results.definition: the manner in which something is greeted
a statement (either spoken or written) that is made to reply to a question or request or criticism or accusation
a phrase recited or sung by the congregation following a versicle by the priest or minister

examples: this situation developed in response to events in Africa

results.definition: the manner in which an electrical or mechanical device responds to an input signal or a range of input signals
